programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank works to vindicate a detective accused of using excessive force; Danny and Baez track down the killer responsible for the death of a rapper's bodyguard; Jamie is skeptical about a relationship between Espinoza and a rookie officer.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Frank is conflicted about how to deal with a former cop's gripe about his pension; Jamie helps a friend deal with illicit pictures of his daughter on the internet; Anthony confronts the realization that his foster son isn't suited for police work.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Jamie and Frank oppose each other's viewpoints over the public's treatment of cops after rowdy teens pour water on two rookies; Danny and Baez investigate a man who preys on the elderly; Erin is forced to admit her wrongdoings.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Henry and Danny butt heads over a case involving a man who is volatile toward his wife; Frank is caught in the middle of an ongoing battle between the NYPD and the FDNY; Erin ponders a life-changing opportunity.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: Erin disagrees with a psychiatric consultant's diagnosis of a nanny accused of abuse; Eddie confronts her boss; Frank is forced to make staffing changes he is skeptical about; a woman claims she heard someone plotting a murder.

programme.title: Blue Bloods
programme.desc: After a woman is found dead at a men's-only club, Danny and Baez investigate if her death was an accident; Frank hears about an alleged affair between the chief of Internal Affairs and the spouse of another member of law enforcement.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: After a hot air balloon lands on the rig while they are going down the road, Will and Sonny get involved in an old man's obsession with entering his balloon, The Old South, in a race.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Sonny contracts for eight additional rigs for hauling chickens only to face disaster when a chicken epidemic closes the processing plant.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: After hauling the equipment trailer for a singing group, Will and Sonny help the group's manager get even with a con man...who cheated Sonny years before.

programme.title: Movin' On
programme.desc: Sonny and Will go to a steel mill in Georgia to pick up a load and they meet a lady trucker who, along with all the other local truckers, has to deal with a crooked mill owner.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: During a blackout in New Orleans, Pride is determined to figure out who murdered a family friend's fiance.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: A Marine's murder reveals new clues in the first case LaSalle and Pride worked together; a Thanksgiving celebration at Pride's bar.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Wade's adopted son becomes a suspect after a series of Christmas burglaries turn deadly; Brody and LaSalle tease Sonja about the team's holiday gift exchange.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: Special Agent Pride and the team investigate a Russian sleeper agent involved with Abby's brother; Sebastian goes to Washington, D.C., to work with Abby; Bishop drives all night to deliver a package and help the New Orleans team.

programme.title: NCIS: New Orleans
programme.desc: The staged suicide of a petty officer turns out to be murder; the team secretly works on an online dating profile for Pride.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Lindsay and Ruzek respond when a car crashes through a crowd of concert goers and a gunman opens fire; Burgess sees Atwater's brother somewhere he shouldn't be.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The body of a college student is found with a backpack full of a drug linked to deadly overdoses around the city; Tay finds a bloodied child with a dark story about his parents; Mouse looks to re-enlist in the army.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: While responding to a complaint, Burgess and Sorensen find the body of a 16-year-old girl in a baseball player's (Billy Burke) house; Lindsay receives a mysterious delivery that might have ties to her past.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When the only witness to the rape and murder of a young man gets killed, the team suspects that someone was paid to take the victim out; Antonio receives a job offer from the state attorney's office.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A highly trained killer is believed to be targeting the police department; Lindsay speaks to Antonio about his job with the state's attorney.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Severide is brought in for questioning after it is discovered that his car has been involved in a deadly crash; Lindsay considers meeting her estranged father.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Evidence from the case of a young woman who was shot to death confirms the Chicago P.D. has a serial killer on its hands; Voight welcomes Kenny Rixton to the team when Ruzek takes another assignment.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The investigation into the murder of a sex offender leads to a private police force operating independently of the Chicago PD; Halstead checks Jimmy's DNA to find out if he really is Lindsay's father.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A priest and parishioners block law enforcement from entering a church where two murder suspects are suspected of hiding; Rixton is caught in a lie with Voight.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: When the crushed body of a young teen who ran away from a treatment center for troubled girls is found in an abandoned building, Voight sends Halstead under cover as a guard to investigate the center from the inside.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The team investigates a home explosion that left a charred body, one injured survivor and no witnesses; Lindsay and Halstead receive a strange warning about Rixton.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Olinsky goes under cover as a hit man for hire after Lindsay is tipped off about a grieving father looking to avenge his daughter's death; when Ruzek returns from his undercover assignment, Voight puts him on patrol duty.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: Olinsky's daughter is in critical condition following a massive warehouse fire; Voight investigates the fire's potential origins; intelligence examines connections between the building owner, those who were inside, and potential arson suspects.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: A hiker leads intelligence to a young woman being held captive in the woods near Chicago; a former relationship of Halstead's comes back into the picture, much to the surprise of Lindsay.

programme.title: Chicago P.D.
programme.desc: The investigation leads Intelligence to one of Chicago's wealthiest families after a nighttime photographer is murdered over a piece of mysterious footage; Burgess' sister Nicole visits the district and presents an icy attitude toward Ruzek.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: When a locally renowned Jazz pianist is murdered, Nick wants to conduct an investigation. However, a headstrong author who wants to write a book about the case shadows Nick, creating a power struggle between the two of them.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A woman hires Nick to track down her sister who has stolen a highly dangerous poisonous substance from a lab.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: A serial killer stalks Sylvie.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: An old flame of Nick's shows up. Although she's the one who cost him his job with the DEA, Nick is willing to let bygones be bygones, until he realizes that suspicious deaths seem to have followed her to Key Mariah.

programme.title: Tropical Heat
programme.desc: Nick Slaughter, a disgraced former Canadian Mountie, and DEA Agent moves to the tropical island paradise of Key Mariah. Once there he starts his own Private Detective Agency, and meets Sylvie Girard, a local travel agent. Together they form a strong friendship and quite the detective team. However, the local police squad never make it easy for them luckily they have plenty of friends to help along the way. The Town of Key Mariah will never be the same again thanks to Nick Slaughter and company!

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Phil makes a rocket out of plastic bottles; crushing a steel drum with air pressure.

programme.title: Science Max: Experiments at Large
programme.desc: Simple machines: levers, rollers, ramps and pulleys can be used to raise more, move more and roll more weight than you can possibly lift!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: The Siberian Tiger is the biggest cat in the World. It takes down large prey with its 5 inch long canine teeth. And the American badgers sharp front claws make it one of the best burrowers. Plus toads undergo one of the most amazing transformations!

programme.title: Xploration Animal Science
programme.desc: Vultures' super strong stomach acid and immunity to deadly bacteria.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we head to the bright sunshine and clear waters of the Bahamas. Philippe will start off getting up close underwater with Great Hammerhead sharks. Then we join a professional freediver to get a look at the world's deepest saltwater blue hole. After that it's into the mangroves to see how local researchers have been tracking baby lemon sharks for decades.

programme.title: Xploration Awesome Planet
programme.desc: This week we look to debunk a few predatory myths from our oceans to deserts. We join the shark research team at the University of Miami for two days of shark studies--first right by the city skyline and then further out to sea. We then head to Florida where Philippe will visit an antivenom lab home to hundreds of venomous snakes. We also see how venomous snakes use defense mechanisms to scare.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A seemingly harmless surveillance job turns deadly; in hope of saving Kono, Adam considers making a sacrifice.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When a zombielike man is shot, the team members are led to a madman who is performing experiments on humans.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: When Mary gets sick, McGarrett and the team must watch her newly adopted baby while they investigate the murder of an undercover ATF agent.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: The governor asks McGarrett and Grover to serve a warrant to a young computer hacker (Nick Jonas) in order to protect national security.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: A secret service agent is murdered while the president is traveling to Oahu; as Thanksgiving approaches, McGarrett's Aunt Deb (Carol Burnett) visits and shares a stunning secret.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: An attempted murder leads the team to investigate a deadly crime committed in Hawaii during World War II.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: One of Grover's friends disappears after apparently committing a murder.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: Chin is questioned about his father's murder and how his relationship with Malia and her family could have adversely affected the investigation.

programme.title: Hawaii Five-0
programme.desc: An escaped convict who wants Five-0 to prove his innocence abducts Danny and McGarrett; Grace punches a person at school.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: Participants Matt and Michelle face tough choices regarding drug use that put their safety, and time in the program, at risk.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: Innocent volunteers are sent to prison for 60 days, without officers or inmates knowing their secret, offering an unfiltered look at life behind bars.

programme.title: 60 Days In
programme.desc: Suspicions surround the male participants; the women struggle to continue, as one considers dropping out of the program.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout history, many have believed that certain places, things, or even people can be tainted with dark curses. Ominous lakes that morph into watery graves.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: What makes us want to create magnificent buildings that are bigger and grander than ourselves--and last for centuries?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: The total disregard for life exhibited by serial killers shocks our sense of humanity and makes us question our safety and security.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Scientists are involved in a never-ending quest to understand the vast universe the planet inhabits; it seems that for each answer science provides, even more questions arise.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: A look at whether or not Area 51's notoriety acts as a cover-up to much bigger, top-secret extraterrestrial experiments taking place at multiple locations.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Counting down the top artifacts that could provide evidence that extraterrestrials once walked among us.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Some 2,600 years ago, the most sacred relic of the ancient world suddenly disappeared from history.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Millions of people around the world have reported encountering shadowy entities who instill fear, shortness of breath, and even paralysis; they could be figments of the imagination or visitors from other worlds or dimensions.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: According to Ancient Astronaut Theorists, the placement of monoliths and their geological makeup could point to extraterrestrial intervention.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Ancient alien theorists speculate about why many of the architectural marvels of the ancient world bear striking similarities to one another even though they were built by civilizations separated by thousands of miles.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Antarctica may serve as home base for extraterrestrial visitors to Earth, but as human exploration of the frozen continent increases, humans may come face to face with the ruins of an ancient advanced civilization buried beneath the ice.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A powerful union activist disappears from a Detroit suburb; 45 years later, it remains one of the most notorious missing person cases of all time; the mystery of Jimmy Hoffa's disappearance features more twists and turns than a Hollywood movie.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: It's one of the most famous prehistoric monuments on Earth -- a mysterious arrangement of stones that have adorned the English countryside for millennia; nobody knows how the landmark was built or why.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Following news of the history-making discovery of Sir Ernest Shackleton's ship the Endurance, this is a look at his historic and ill-fated 1914 Antarctic expedition resulting in the loss of the highly revered ship.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: On Christmas morning in 1945, five siblings vanish from their family home in West Virginia during a raging fire; despite the work of dozens of investigators and thousands of amateur sleuths, the mystery remains.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: They've been called the world's greatest archaeological enigma: 2,000-year-old geoglyphs made in the Peruvian desert that span over 50 miles; the drawings are so massive, they can only be seen from the air.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: In July 1996, one of the worst aviation disasters in American history leaves 230 people dead and countless questions unanswered; it's a tragedy that changes the aviation industry forever.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A powerful union activist disappears from a Detroit suburb; 45 years later, it remains one of the most notorious missing person cases of all time; the mystery of Jimmy Hoffa's disappearance features more twists and turns than a Hollywood movie.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: It's one of the most famous prehistoric monuments on Earth -- a mysterious arrangement of stones that have adorned the English countryside for millennia; nobody knows how the landmark was built or why.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Following news of the history-making discovery of Sir Ernest Shackleton's ship the Endurance, this is a look at his historic and ill-fated 1914 Antarctic expedition resulting in the loss of the highly revered ship.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: The Aryan Brotherhood of Texas is a white supremacist gang that boasted thousands of members inside and outside of prison throughout Texas and the United States; most of the gang's violence outside of prison is inflicted upon its own members.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: With a taste of success and the lure of easy money, Thelma started transporting cocaine and heroin between Los Angeles and Philadelphia.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Bostic's New Breeds would package and distribute heroin and defend their turf with violence.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Salvatore "Sammy the Bull" Gravano, the most notorious turncoat in mafia history, pledges loyalty to John Gotti until Gotti himself gets the Bull to change his mind.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: Before he hunted down his first victim in the wilds of Alaska, Robert Hansen was a successful businessman with a family in Anchorage, but his intense feelings would build into a dark desire to exert the ultimate control over 17 victims.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: Growing up gay and effeminate in the hyper masculine bayou was tough on Ronald Dominique; an inability to connect and a sexual assault in jail may have cemented his decision to kill his first victim, tragically the beginning of years of murder.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: The articulate and boastful killer is remembered for terrifying the coastal town of Santa Cruz, where he picked up and dismembered hitchhiking college students in the early 1970s.

programme.title: Surviving a Serial Killer
programme.desc: David McVicker was unaware he'd climbed into the van of murderer William Bonin when he hitchhiked home at 14 years old; David survived but was left scarred.

programme.title: Surviving a Serial Killer
programme.desc: Unaware that he was a killer, Delia Balmer begins a relationship with John Sweeney after meeting him in a pub in Camden; more than three years later, he has Delia lined up as his next victim.

programme.title: Evil Up Close: Women Who Kill
programme.desc: A trusted nanny to three young children snaps after being plagued by demonic voices, leading to devastating consequences for the family she worked for.

programme.title: Evil Up Close
programme.desc: Erika and her boyfriend Omar plotted to kill Erika's parents and set up home as parents to her little brother.

programme.title: Escaping Evil: My Life in a Cult
programme.desc: After years of suffering abuse at the hands of her father, Flora Jessop makes a daring escape from the Fundamentalist Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-Day Saints in Colorado City, Ariz.

programme.title: Escaping Evil: My Life in a Cult
programme.desc: Leslie Wagner-Wilson escapes Peoples Temple leader Jim Jones and the largest murder-suicide in history; Susan Justice abandons her family and the twisted teachings of David Berg.

programme.title: Escaping Evil: My Life in a Cult
programme.desc: A man blindly follows black supremacist Yahweh ben Yahweh until he suffers at his leader's hands; a military-structured religious community forces a woman to beat her children.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: Despite their hippie persona and rustic community businesses, the Twelve Tribes have long stood accused of physically abusing children and subjugating of women.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: Growing up in the United Nation of Islam (UNOI), Elijah Muhammad was forced into child labor, physical abuse and squalid living conditions. Today, he has a unique opportunity to speak to the FBI in hope of getting justice for himself and the other children abused by UNOI and its leader, Royall Jenkins', teachings.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: Amy Bril recounts her childhood growing up in the Children of God, a group notorious for pedophilia and "religious" prostitution.

programme.title: Cults and Extreme Belief
programme.desc: Former "Moonie," Teddy Hose, tries to alert the public to a gun-obsessed Unification Church offshoot known as The Sanctuary Church of Newfoundland, PA.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The AGG team adds a newly rebuilt engine and trans to a '63 Volvo P1800.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings in an Auburn Speedster kit car with some serious problems.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team gets a numbers-matching Buick Gran Sport back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings in a pair of panel trucks for engine and body work.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A local Camaro club has brought in a few stock Camaros for modifications.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '61 Eldorado convertible has some power accessories that need attention.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cristy stops into the shop in the middle of a motorcycle tour of Florida.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew helps a wife track down a '67 Firebird her husband sold years ago.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew fixes the hide-away headlights and AC on a '67 Camaro RS-SS.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2017 Corvette Grand Sport needs just one thing to push it over the top.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team rebuilds the bucket seats and interior on a '70 Dodge Challenger.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cristy wants to get her Grandma's Grand Prix back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A man brings his dad's '82 Corvette to the shop for an interior makeover.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team restores and then flips a vintage '63 split-window Corvette.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cristy talks Rachel and Bogi into helping her restore and flip a Yamaha R6.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew takes drastic measures to seal all of a '69 Cougar's leaks.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew checks off items from a wish list for a military mom's Mustang.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew finds some parts to give a '78 Mustang some new life.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi finds a BMW M3 she wants for herself, but it needs a lot of work.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team beefs up a Scat Pack Challenger with twin turbos and new axles.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Cutlass needs a new top, plus a lot of work on the interior.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '33 Ford Roadster with a dead cylinder is getting a new 355 crate engine.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '53 F-100 on a '99 Lightning chassis has been in project mode for years.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A rare '89 Turbo Trans Am gets items knocked off the owner's wish list.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '75 El Camino swaps its bench seat for bucket seats and a center console.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2011 Jeep Wrangler is a reliable and fun vehicle to drive off to college.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team builds two Indian Scout Bobbers, each with a distinct personality.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The forgotten Mustang is back to have its leaky 302 engine replaced.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A special guest helps build a new Ford F-150 that will be sold for charity.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A Polaris Slingshot and a Vanderhall are in the shop for some upgrades.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '65 C10 lowrider gets a new all-electronic 4L60E transmission.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An autocross Malibu wagon needs work some on the steering before race day.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team retrofits a Jeepster Commando with a custom power-steering setup.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '71 Lincoln gets a boost in power and fuel economy by adding EFI.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring back a vintage Jeepster Commando and convert its vintage brakes from drum to disc.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Addressing what type of maintenance is needed on a company's work truck; the girls demonstrate general maintenance, fix some broken items and give it an upgrade or two.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls tackle an incomplete, but drivable Pontiac GTO convertible by replacing the mechanics in the convertible top and putting on new exterior pieces.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2005 Jeep TJ Wrangler Rubicon is in the All Girls Garage because its owner wants to be able to use it off-road; it will need a new long arm suspension kit, new roll cage and new tires.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1966 Ford Mustang Coupe had an extensive renovation in 2009, but there are a few items that still need to be finished; the girls will address a couple of interior and exterior items to take this restoration project to the finish line.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1989 Toyota Supra has twin turbos and a potent straight 6 engine; the girls will switch out the twin turbos for a single and get more power out of the 1JZ motor; Faye's windshield gets rescued from a rock chip that could be disastrous.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 1971 Pontiac LeMans is brought into the shop with an overheating issue; the crew will upgrade the car's radiator and add electric fans, then go to work replacing some worn interior parts as well.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: One of the lifters in a 1971 Chevy Camaro has stopped working; the team will have to remove the engine in order to upgrade the camshaft, lifters, bearings, and timing chain before putting it all back together.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew gets one of the first Honda Civic Type R's into the shop; the car is already a powerhouse, but it's not good enough for the track, so they will give it some modifications and upgrades to make it race-worthy.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The AGG team performs some minor repairs and adjustments to a 1966 Nova Super Sport so the owner can quickly flip it.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The gang brings a 1976 J10 into the garage for comparison as they personalize a 2020 Jeep Gladiator for a customer.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The gang installs upgrades to a 2017 Ford Mustang GT they find for an empty-nester mom who is looking for some excitement in her life.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Corvette gets a top-end rebuild and a factory exhaust reinstall.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A 2018 Kia stinger GT goes from beast to monster with aftermarket goodies.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '71 Oldsmobile Cutlass goes from an automatic transmission to a manual.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An '03 BMW 325i needs a timing chain and has a parasitic electrical draw.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A '69 Mustang with a supercharged engine needs more throttle response.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls find a stock Mercedes-AMG E 55 and do some European hot rodding.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: An MGB with a Ford Ranger engine isn't running the correct fuel setup.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A Camaro swaps out its 305 small block for a 383 that will make 450hp.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The crew diagnoses and fixes some problems on a Dodge Avenger; they demonstrate how to know when motor mounts are bad, and how to easily fix a cracked bumper.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings in a stock supercharged CTS-V and converts it to twin turbos; they put an intake manifold where the supercharger was, and then put in a new exhaust that includes turbos.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: This mid-engine classic needs to get back on the road; the crew goes through the engine to see if it needs a rebuild, then overhauls the fuel delivery system to get this build over some major hurdles.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The team brings back the 442 Tribute car to give it a new LS engine and finish modifying the interior for the previously-installed TKO transmission.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Four gears are better than two, so the crew takes the old two-speed Powerglide out of a '67 Chevy Camaro and installs a Muncie four speed.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The new-generation, mid-engine Corvette is here, and the girls take one for a test drive; the C8 is already cool, but they make it better with aftermarket exhaust and some other goodies.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring in Faye's 1980 VW Rabbit for some fabrication.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls have to figure out why an '87 C10 isn't running anymore; they know it's a fuel problem that happened after an EFI setup was installed; they finish up with a new disc-brake kit; Bogi takes a field trip to show how custom fuel lines are made.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye show how to rebuild and upgrade an R154 manual transmission so it will last as long as the Toyota engine; they also drop a valve body on an automatic transmission, drilling it out and adding stronger sleeves to keep it lasting longer.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls take an old AMC Spirit drag car and get it ready for the street by changing out the oversized carb. They bring in a special guest to help them pick out the right carb and tune it on the car.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: The girls bring in a rare Caprice cop car to bolt on a supercharger from a second-generation CTS-V; they'll make brackets for the intercooler, bolt on the supercharger and give the rare cop car some extra power.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Cars die of boredom, so it wasn't great for a Plymouth Prowler to sit in a museum for 15 years; the girls show what areas to fix before the car gets back on the road.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye describe a common failure problem on a fifth-generation Camaro. The torque converter can fail in the transmission, causing the car to shake at 40-50 mph. The girls upgrade the factory torque converter to fix this problem for good.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye show how a worn-out Toyota's steering rack and pinion works, where they fail, and how to rebuild it with a simple rebuild kit.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: A GTO that has spent a lot of its life in shops with mechanics who had no intention of finishing it, is brought in by its owner for some final touches, including checking gauges, air conditioning and the steering column.

programme.title: All Girls Garage
programme.desc: Bogi and Faye find a 1972 Challenger at a customer's house, and when they learned how it was a triple black, they discuss restoring it to original; the work starts with rebuilding the numbers-matching 340.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: After a nationwide search to find the best metal fabrication prospects around, Dave Kindig and KevDogg have invited 12 people to the shop to compete for one job at Kindig-It Design.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The remaining competitors pair up for a challenge to create a signature Kindig-It build feature; teamwork is critical, and the team that can't figure it out will pack their bags.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Dave and Kev divide the group into two teams, and explain the day's assignment; the teams must navigate a tricky exhaust challenge; the losing team will have to make a difficult choice.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Project managers are chosen; designing and executing a wing on a '68 Camaro trunk lid.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: A rusted out, dented fender needs repair, and at the last minute, Dave and Kev throw a curveball.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The ultimate job interview is down to four candidates, and the next test will see how well they can handle a staple project at Kindig-It Design; even with the instructions available, this challenge is not as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The ultimate job interview is down to four candidates, and the next test will see how well they can handle a staple project at Kindig-It Design; even with the instructions available, this challenge is not as easy as it looks.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: Dave challenges the remaining three players to fabricate a grill from design to execution, with the winners getting a spot in the finale.

programme.title: Bitchin' Boot Camp
programme.desc: The final two are ready to prove themselves; Dave and Kev throw another curveball.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Former NFL player Chad Lewis brings Dave an R8 Spyder for customizations.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop gears up for a big show and Dave's plans for an AC go south.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave turns a client's outdated '53 Chevy into a modern, badass hot rod.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The shop's talents are pushed to the max when a '33 Ford Tudor arrives.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The crew attempts to make history as they make a truck that doesn't exist.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave and the crew start on a 1966 Corvette, but his client doesn't want the color to be anywhere close to its original green.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The client is on board with the chosen shade of green, and the car moves into the paint booth.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: A past client returns with a 1965 Mustang Fastback, and though he likes the stock look, he wants to upgrade the drivetrain, instrumentation and as many modern amenities as possible; the assembly team gets a crash course in engine tuning.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: An active-duty serviceman and his father are finally ready to finish their 1951 Ford pickup.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1951 pickup is painted and ready for final assembly.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Fixing a '32 Ford that caught fire after an accident.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: Dave designs a Mustang for the ages to compete in the Optima Challenge; the build includes a new front facia and hood and redesigning the rear end.

programme.title: Bitchin' Rides
programme.desc: The 1965 Mustang makes its way through the metal shop and is now ready for paint and final assembly; making it function will test even the Kindig crew.

programme.title: Through the Storm
programme.desc: Follows the 2023 season of the Red Lake Nation (Ojibwe) high school football team. Despite dwindling interest and a two-decade-long losing record, a determined coach and group of young athletes fight to keep their football program alive. An exploration in overcoming loss, the film follows the personal triumphs and hardships of the players and their families, and how football serves as a symbol of hope, unity, and resilience for the people of Red Lake.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The first open event of the 2004 WSOP would see 834 entrants create a prize pool of over $1.5 million. David "Chip" Reese and Erick Lindgren both fell just short of the final table as the United Kingdom's James Vogl enters the final table as chip leader ahead of J.C. Tran, David Chiu, and Shawn Rice as all eyes are on the $400,000 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The star-studded final table of the $1,500 Stud would see WSOP bracelet winners Men Nguyen, Ted Forrest, and Minh Nguyen looking to add more WSOP gold to their trophy case. Chad Brown would be eyeing his first WSOP bracelet as $111,440 in first-place prize money was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: Nearly 800 rebuys would take this field size to 1,334 and a prize pool of over $1.26 million. The final table would be stacked with tournament veterans led by Daniel Negreanu, John Juanda, Mike Matusow, Lee Markholt, Paul Phillips, and Ram Vaswani as all eyes were on the $365,900 first-place prize.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The 831-entrant field created a $1.14 million prize pool in the first $1,500 No-Limit Hold'em event of the 2004 WSOP. Poker author Blair Rodman, and tournament regulars Joe Awada, Scott Epstein, and Kent Washington held seats at the final table, along with "The Crew" member Scott Fischman as the $300,000 first-place prize was up for grabs.

programme.title: World Series of Poker
programme.desc: The biggest No-Limit Hold'em buy-in of the 2004 WSOP outside of the Main Event would attract 254 entrants and create a prize pool of $1,193,800. Barry Greenstein and Dewey Tomko fell short of reaching the final table, as WSOP veterans James Sousa and Paul "Eskimo" Clark headlined the final table ahead of Lee Watkinson, Thomas Keller, Martin de Knijff, and Young Phan as they chased the $382,020 first-place prize.

programme.title: Entanglement
programme.desc: In Atlanta, a down-on-his-luck radio DJ gets his heart broken on the air, then as his career rises, meets a caller whom he once gave romantic advice.

programme.title: A Very Merry New Year
programme.desc: A Fortune 500 CEO decides to gather her best high school friends for a New Year's Eve reunion celebration that winds up exposing long-hidden secrets.

programme.title: Animal
programme.desc: In this crime-drama starring football superstar Jim Brown, a notorious gangster must reconcile his past in order to make a future for his criminally-minded son.

programme.title: A Christmas Miracle
programme.desc: When an accident forces her to confront her past, a successful but ungrateful blues singer must face the music, and count her blessings.

programme.title: A Christmas Family Secret
programme.desc: After sacrificing family for success, a career-driven woman decides to surprise her father on Christmas and gets a surprise of her own.

programme.title: Clover
programme.desc: When her father dies shortly after his remarriage, a young African American girl struggles to cope while left in the care of her new, white stepmom.

programme.title: The Long Walk Home
programme.desc: Set in 1955 Montgomery, Alabama, this is the story of two women who must decide how they will respond to Martin Luther King Jr.’s call to boycott.

programme.title: The Aftermath
programme.desc: After the new guy botches a perfectly planned armored car heist, four crafty criminals are left trapped, with the police closing in on them.

programme.title: Imprisoned by Love
programme.desc: Below the surface of her perfect life, Tracie weathers constant marital abuse for the sake of her children. What will it cost to save herself?

programme.title: Book of Songs
programme.desc: A down on his luck musician is antagonistic to the churchgoers next door until he is introduced to the bible through music, leading to an epiphany.

programme.title: Christmas With the Carters
programme.desc: When their Christmas gift budget is destroyed by the theft of an expensive watch, a family must band together to find it and steal it back by surviving the most chaotic Christmas Eve of their lives.

programme.title: My Other Mother
programme.desc: Adopted as a child, an anchorwoman finds herself reconnecting with her birth mother and extended family while attending the funeral of her father.

programme.title: Marvin’s Christmas
programme.desc: Marvin’s family decides it’s time for him to move out of the house, and his comfort zone, during the holidays as a new love interest enters his life.

programme.title: Deceitful Storm
programme.desc: A wife makes the shocking discovery that her husband is cheating on her. God can forgive him, but is he willing to atone for his sins?

programme.title: Reindeer Games
programme.desc: A man encounters an unexpected curveball during the holiday season and must learn the true value of falling and staying in love.

programme.title: Hav Faith
programme.desc: A man is elevated to lead a prominent church where issues arise between him, the son of the retiring bishop and a money-hungry real estate broker.

programme.title: Our Dream Christmas
programme.desc: Gabby and her family spend one last Christmas in LA with her dying mom, where secrets are revealed that could threaten their tranquility.

programme.title: A True Christmas
programme.desc: Reminded of her past, Jessica can't stand Christmas, but this holiday season has several surprises in store that will help her create new memories.

programme.title: It Ain’t Easy
programme.desc: Mack is the son of a prostitute, and has picked up the trade of becoming a pimp, until he decides to seek revenge on his enemy, Memphis Slim.

programme.title: For the Love of Christmas
programme.desc: Rashad Williams faces down the pressures of making a dramatic career choice and getting married to Lauren—and all before Christmas Day.

programme.title: Single Bells
programme.desc: When the Bell sisters lose their family restaurant during Christmas, they hatch a plan to save it—and unexpectedly find romance along the way.

programme.title: Resurrecting the Champ
programme.desc: A struggling sports reporter sees a career opportunity when he rescues a homeless man only to discover that he is a boxing legend long thought dead.

programme.title: Coming Home For Christmas
programme.desc: Coming from mixed backgrounds, adopted siblings Smythe, Hanna, Bea, Shane and Lonny, along with parents Pat and Samantha, will have to search for a higher spirit to get them through the holiday season.

programme.title: The Christmas Spirit
programme.desc: This Christmas, Faith is forced to choose between taking over her recently deceased father's church or handing it over to a new minister.

programme.title: Christmas on My Block
programme.desc: A holiday film with grit and soul as two men from very different sides of the tracks end up changing each other’s lives in permanent ways.

programme.title: #Respectfully Justin

programme.title: The Searchers
programme.desc: In this revered Western, Ethan Edwards (John Wayne) returns home to Texas after the Civil War. When members of his brother's family are killed or abducted by Comanches, he vows to track down his surviving relatives and bring them home. Eventually, Edwards gets word that his niece Debbie (Natalie Wood) is alive, and, along with her adopted brother, Martin Pawley (Jeffrey Hunter), he embarks on a dangerous mission to find her, journeying deep into Comanche territory.

programme.title: A Miracle on Christmas Lake
programme.desc: After suffering the loss of his best friend Charlie on Christmas Eve, sixteen year old Bobby Whiteside ventures out onto the lake where they played countless games of winter hockey. Upon shoveling the ice surface he makes a shocking discovery --- a magic, perfectly groomed hockey rink that appears only at night and only in his presence. When a local construction company purchases the land for development, Bobby must join forces with his high school crush, rally the town, and play one last game on the night pond --- with an old friend.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Ronnie and Steph Caird welcome their rivals to Inn at the Park in Aberdeen. where it is all about keeping it in the family. But one guest's culinary background piles on the pressure for Ronnie at breakfast.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Shauna and Fiona welcome their rivals to Ingliston Country Club in Renfrewshire. But Steve and Allard think the décor is dated, and a breakfast waiting game causes a storm in a teacup.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Steve and Allard welcome their rivals to 1692 Wasdale in the Lake District. Fiona and Shauna think it's picture perfect, but other guests face tricky technology and cleanliness concerns.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to Blackpool and confident John welcomes his rivals to the Lynbar Hotel. He says his breakfast is the best in Blackpool and hopes his guests will agree.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts in Pencader, Wales and the School House bed and breakfast, owned by eco-friendly couple Jayne and Ian, where they hope their environmental approach will win over their guests.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Cathedral 73 in Cardiff, managed by Neil Chidzey and Assistant Manager Jo Goodwin. Guests are wowed by the glamorous rooms, but the costs prove hard to swallow.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: For the third visit of the week the group head to Leafy Suburban bed and breakfast in Northwood, where golfer Raj Kumar opens the doors to his home. However, Neil and Jo are not impressed with a surprise visitor.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to The Wellington Inn in Hertfordshire where resources manager Felicity Rainbow takes a spiritual approach to hosting - but the `Welly' twist is not a hit with everyone.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at the Strontian Boutique in Strontian, Scotland, where Callum Pegg and his partner head chef Darren Anderson want to treat their guests to an exclusive stay.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to The Helix Hotel in Grangemouth, Stirlingshire, where host Nawaz Haq wants to show off his hotel, catering to the travelling businessman. Come morning, the group raises concerns over the breakfast banquet.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to The Black Boy Hotel in Sudbury, where hosts Kate Martin and sister Marie Carlton want their guests to kick back and embrace the historical surroundings.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit is to The Lodge Bed and Breakfast in Cannock, Staffordshire, where hosts Lee and Marie Garnett are hoping their guests take to their homely BandB, but have they done enough to win?

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at the Ship Inn in Dymchurch, Kent run by 21-year-old partners James Tindall and Jessica Walton, who believe age is but a number. Over breakfast, a frank airing of views sets the standard for the week.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Thompson Hall Retreat in Norfolk, run by mother and daughter duo Amanda and Becci. On arrival, everyone is wowed by the stylish shepherd huts with outside bath.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions are simmering as the guests head to The White House in Brighton.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Jacobs Plough in Bicester, Oxfordshire, run by manager Duncan Froomes and bar supervisor Ryan Hunt who like to mix banter with business. The criticism continues, with feedback that leaves the hosts praying for a miracle.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Edenmore Guest House in Ardrossan, owner Hugh Begbie dreads the prospect of guests who are too `kissy-kissy, touchy-touchy'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Day two of the competition is at Grassington Lodge in Yorkshire, where owner Diane Lowe reckons `Diane's little touches' have helped make her rooms a cut above.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Jeanette and Andrew Collette are the third hosts to open their doors in this particular competition. They welcome their fellow B and Bers to their homestay - Manor Farm in Oxfordshire.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The week's final visit is to The George and Dragon in Princess Risborough, Buckinghamshire, owned by fun-loving publicans Ian and Elle Betchley.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Langsmeade House in Thame, Oxfordshire, Dutch-born owner Marianne Abben and her trusty housekeeper Fran Birchwood are hoping to meet some troublemakers.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Stratford House Guesthouse in Stratford-upon-Avon, where couple Natasha and Dai Pollock juggle the demands of bringing up a young family with running a B&B.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to pet-friendly Edmund House in Deal in Kent where owner Michael Prime is joined by his doting mum Lorna.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This visit is to the Five Bells Pub in Berkshire, where entrepreneur Mark Genders hopes his guests will think his small rooms are perfectly formed. However, he admits his `very' honest appraisal of his rivals' offerings may work against him.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This competition kicks off at Nateby Inn in Cumbria, where landlady Gaynor Walker is ready with a warm welcome. A trip to Gaynor's local brewery turns out to be a barrel of laughs.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to Ravensden, Bedfordshire, where owners Graham and Julia Ashley run Outfields Farm B&B. The hosts treat their guests to an adrenaline-fuelled afternoon at an indoor sky diving centre.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the week is to At Home in Chiswick, London, where artist Bob Osborne takes a laid-back approach to running his B&B. Guests are pleasantly surprised by their first impression of Bob's communal living space-come-mini art gallery.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to Chard, Somerset, where Andrew and Clare Ashmore own the Ammonite Lodge guesthouse.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The new competition kicks off at Abbey House in Penrith, Cumbria, where Ian Sugden sees himself as the `brawn' in the operation while his wife Sam, a part-time nurse, is the `brains'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Compton House, in Newark, Nottinghamshire, Lisa Holloway prides herself on providing a home from home for her guests. Sadly, Sam and Ian Sugden are disappointed by the dust, while Dave and wife Jo, find the price for a night hard to swallow.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Dave and Jo Bate hope their guests at The White Horse pub and B&B in Ripon, North Yorkshire, will embrace the pub vibe, but sadly Ed and Jane Mitchell get locked in their room by mistake.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to the Old Farmhouse in Cheshire, where retired teachers Ed and Jane Mitchell shock some of their guests by offering only a shared bathroom, but that's nothing compared to Sam and Ian's reaction to what they find under the bed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit this week is to Knockaloe Beg farm on the Isle of Man, where owners Fiona and John Anderson hope their guests will embrace their green ethos. Blackpool B&B'ers Robbie and John Welling are surprised that it is so clean 'for a farm'.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to The Arches on the Isle of Man where ex-demolition man Phil Routledge is proud of his super-modern B&B, which was voted the best in the Isle of Man. On arrival, his guests are blown away by the views.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to the Trafford in Blackpool owned by couple Robbie and John who are proud of their traditional bucket and spade B&B. On arrival the guests are pleasantly surprised, even if previous host Phil is hell-bent on finding some dust.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit of the week is to the grand Sheepy Lodge in Warwickshire where empty-nester Julie loves to fill her manor house with people - as long as they don't order poached eggs.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: At Dunsandles Guest House in New Brighton, Merseyside, owner Alan Johnson and his best mate and professional sidekick Dave Owen hope to be crowned best value B&B of the week.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: This visit is to the Lady Teal Hotel Boat on the waterways near Burnley in Lancashire, owned by Nick and Gina Mead.The afternoon entertainment is some freezing competition out on the locks.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit of the competition is to York House in Tetbury, Gloucestershire, where Brock Bergius hopes his cheeky sense of humour and perfectionist nature will help him win the competition.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final day of the competition is at Heyford House in Lower Heyford, Oxfordshire. The afternoon event is boxing, which Brock sees as a perfect opportunity to settle some scores with Dave and Alan.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Tensions boil over as the group come face to face, before the winner is revealed.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition starts at The Oak Tree Cottage in Burley, where owner Jacqui Castle is the first to host.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the week is to The Rising Sun Inn in Bath, where owners Lorraine Hawkins and Norman Butcher hope to bring their guests up to standard by having a dress code.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The third visit is to The Busfeild Arms in East Morton.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit is to Epstein House in Liverpool, where there are some shocking revelations all round.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.desc: The second visit is to The Partridge in Oxfordshire.

programme.desc: The third visit is to Strawberry Gardens B&B in Heysham.

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final visit of the week is to The Bateman’s Mill near Chesterfield.

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: 1 vs. 100
programme.desc: Professional dancer Carrie Ann Inaba hosts this show in which a contestant can win $50,000. The contestant, known as the One, competes with a mob of 100 other players by answering questions. When the One answers correctly, each member of the mob that answered incorrectly is eliminated. The One earns money for each mob member who is eliminated. If the One can eliminate the entire mob, he wins $50,000. But if the One gets a question wrong, he is eliminated and the remaining mob members split his winnings.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: The ultimate guessing game kicks off with the first six undercover celebrity singers – PEACOCK, HIPPO, MONSTER, UNICORN, DEER and LION – facing off against one another in elaborate head-to-toe costumes. Host Nick Cannon joins panelists Ken Jeong, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger and Robin Thicke as they attempt to guess WHO is the performer behind the mask. Between all twelve of the celebrity competitors on the show, they’ve amassed 65 Grammy nominations, 16 multi-Platinum albums, 16 Emmy nominations, nine Broadway shows, four stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and four Super Bowl titles. One singer will be eliminated each week, ultimately revealing his or her true identity. Hear them sing, get the clues and guess the celebrity.

programme.title: The Masked Singer
programme.desc: The second group of six undercover celebrity singers take the stage: RABBIT, ALIEN, RAVEN, PINEAPPLE, POODLE and BEE. Host Nick Cannon joins panelists Ken Jeong, Jenny McCarthy, Nicole Scherzinger and Robin Thicke as they attempt to guess WHO is the performer behind the mask. Between all 12 of the celebrity competitors on the show, they’ve amassed 65 Grammy nominations, 16 multi-Platinum albums, 16 Emmy nominations, nine Broadway shows, four stars on the Hollywood Walk of Fame and four Super Bowl titles. One singer will be eliminated each week, ultimately revealing his or her true identity. Hear them sing, get the clues and guess the celebrity.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: In this episode, contestants face different games like Dizzy Dummies and The Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: The Towers and Donuts, The Pole Vault, Dogeball, The Barrel Crossing and Double Beams are some of the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Twenty contestants take on one of television's largest and most extreme obstacle courses.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: You will see 10 celebrities get wet and repeatedly face tough obstacles in order to win the grand final.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: This episode sees the return of the finalists from across the series as they compete for the ultimate title.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Slippery Stairs, Block Swing, The Crusher, Log Roll, and Barrel Crossing are some of the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: 20 crazy contestants will face the Donut Run, Donut swing, The Tails and Tippy Tables in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Richard Hammond presents the annual Total Wipeout trophy-athon.

programme.title: Wipeout Canada
programme.desc: Beam and Jets, Field Goal Swing, The Toothbrush Bristles, Tippy Tables and Dock Maze are among some of the over-the-top obstacles in this week’s episode.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: It’s Sitcom Central on Wipeout Australia with the Odd Couple, starring World’s Strongest Dwarf, David Clarke and Gentle Giant, Tim Watts. Once again the Big Balls deliver some spectacular moments with an Italian Chef being sliced and diced. Sacks are introduced at the Sweeper proving too much for some, but surprisingly helping the ladies to even things out as we go into a 50/50 male, female split in the Wipeout Zone.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: Showdowns don’t come more epic than this. Pro Wrestler Mikey takes on Wipeout Australias very own Tom Cruise. Its neck and neck through the qualifier which this week includes a real Mission Impossible, Dirty Balls. The trash talk is as fierce as the competition and continues to the Wipeout Zone with the winner taking not only the $20,000 but also the glory. Australia is also introduced to a new kind of “violent love”, the Fight Hug.

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: Total Wipeout is back with this exciting last season!

programme.title: Total Wipeout
programme.desc: 20 fabulous contestants travel halfway across the globe to the purpose-built course in Buenos Aires.

programme.title: Wipeout Australia
programme.desc: From singing Pastors to Wookies, this week is jammed pack with Characters, who battle it out on the Qualifier with amusing attempts at the inconceivable Field Goal Swing. Its no easy task to earn a spot in the Wipeout Zone this week with the Dreadmill, sorting the men from the boys. Contestants must dodge the wrecking ball while shooting basketballs. Although there is one man who came prepared, Dodgeball Champion Dan Bennett, whose “Duck, Dive, Dip, Dodge and Dunk” training comes into play.

programme.title: Total Wipeout

programme.desc: Fashion comes to Wipeout Australia as we meet Adam “God’s Gift” Marshall, a self styled Ad man who conquers the Qualifier. Other Catwalk moments include the Grandpa in his Red Speedos and a Rainbow Bright Personal Ad. If jumping a revolving arm while balancing on a pedestal above water isn’t enough for you then you’ll love this weeks Sweeper. Contestants are armed with Dodgeballs, to be deployed at each other, creating horrific hits and spectacular spills. The Dizzy Dummy claims its first victim as Dummy Tummy rejects a contestant and the Wipeout Zone becomes a battle of young and old.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The Top 20 junior home cooks face an out-of-this-world Mystery Box challenge with special guest astronaut Tracy Dyson, during which they must prepare a unique dish that highlights a stellar ingredient. The one who rockets to the top will have a significant advantage in the elimination challenge, when the contestants will be tasked with creating a stunning and delicious fish dish in order to move onto the next round.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: On the next episode of MASTERCHEF JUNIOR, the remaining 18 junior home cooks will face their first team challenge of the season and the first-ever MASTERCHEF JUNIOR team relay race. Each team must create a large serving of seven-layer dip. The team that completes the dip first will be safe from the next elimination challenge, and choose the smelly, wrinkly or spicy ingredients for that challenge. Find out who will smell their way to victory and who will dip lower in the competition.

programme.desc: The remaining junior home cooks squeeze in a seven-minute team challenge, in which they must make a batch of raspberry mint lemonade for judge Christina Tosi to blind taste test. programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: After a tough elimination challenge, the Top 12 junior home cooks face their next task when the judges test their senses in a blind taste challenge. Each contestant will blindly taste a dish prepared by Gordon Ramsay and then must recreate the dish. The contestant with the dish that best reflects Gordon’s dish will receive a significant advantage. In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will prepare VIP dishes for a dining room of all grandmothers for their first restaurant challenge. Each team will create a unique dish of “new” ingredients and the team with the most votes will be safe from elimination. Find out who will move on to the Top 10 and who will leave.

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: In the next team challenge, the junior home cooks will face an egg-cellent challenge and compete in pairs to see who can complete the most deviled eggs in 12 minutes. The team that perfects the most deviled eggs will be safe from the next elimination challenge, in which contestants must create their future cookbook’s signature dish. In the second hour, Christina Tosi brings a special guest into the MASTERCHEF kitchen, her mom, to present the next mystery box challenge, which will feature all of Christina’s favorite childhood foods. Then, contestants will compete in a tag team platter challenge using international street food ingredients.

In the second hour, Christina Tosi brings a special guest into the MASTERCHEF kitchen, her mom, to present the next mystery box challenge, which will feature all of Christina’s favorite childhood foods. Then, contestants will compete in a tag team platter challenge using international street food ingredients.

It has a huge impact on every one of the chefs, each is determined to do all he can to get a dish to the banquet.

programme.title: Great British Menu

programme.title: Monty Don's Japanese Gardens

programme.title: Monty Don's Paradise Gardens
programme.desc: In Turkey Monty is dazzled by an extraordinary display of the Ottoman Empire's favourite flower, the tulip, and learns of its sacred significance. Travelling further East to India he encounters a new type of spirituality in the tomb gardens of the Mughal Empire. Stunning mausoleums were set in vast gardens as places where an earthly king could enter a divine paradise.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty travels to Europe and explores the influence of the Venetians on gardening. To begin with, he explores Venice on one of the city's famous barges, stepping out to visit green spaces large and small that are often hidden from view behind high walls.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins in the city of Trieste, close to Italy's border with Croatia, to visit a public garden first created by an obsessive royal plantsman more than 150 years ago, which is now being carefully restored. He then heads down the Adriatic coast through Croatia to pick up the trail that the Venetians followed, ending his journey on the beautiful island of Lopud, near Dubrovnik.

programme.title: Monty Don's Adriatic Gardens
programme.desc: Monty begins the last leg of his journey in Corfu, a Greek island with strong Venetian links, including olive trees planted by them that are still grown today. Here, Monty visits a spectacular garden made by an Englishman with Greek connections.

programme.title: Big Dreams, Small Spaces
programme.desc: Monty Don is asked to rescue two nightmare outside spaces. In Salisbury, newly engaged Glenn and Zoe want a brand new garden and most of all they are desperate to produce flowers for their wedding. Currently their steeply sloping garden is completely unusable.

programme.title: The Journey Within
programme.desc: Mark Peterson is kicking off his North America Deer Slam in the great state of Michigan. Mark cut his teeth in Michigan chasing Whitetails with his dad ever since he was able to walk. Starting this new project focused on deer, it only made sense to launch in his home state of Michigan. With the leaves changing and the rut heating up, Mark hops into one of his favorite stands right off his driveway to try his luck chasing a big Michigan Whitetail.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Another great hunt this week with Intrepid Care. We have the chance to hang out with some Veterans from all over the country. We gather to tell stories, build relationships, and just enjoy the great outdoors. This trip is action packed and the guys are chasing South Texas hogs from the ground.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Each year we get to spend time in camp with some of our best friends. Zach from Big & J gets some time in a blind while reflecting on what hunting in Texas means to him. Texas provides a wide variety of game, and chasing these creatures all across the state is some of the best times had.

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Josh Kinser from Big and J introduced his daughters to hunting throughout South TX. With trips earlier in the year cancelled, Josh and Hattie were invited to join the TTHA crew at G2 ranch. The first night of the hunt proved to be a success for Hattie, wrapping a TX tag around her biggest buck. Josh and Hattie will have memories to last a lifetime after this hunt!

programme.title: Storytellers
programme.desc: Follow TTHA President/CEO Christina Pittman and her husband Matt this week as they tag along side Dr. James Kroll for his annual deer day! This is a great opportunity to learn from one of the best. We are blessed to be able to share his knowledge with other like minded outdoor enthusiasts.

programme.title: The Break
programme.desc: Derek Dirnberger and Joe Hoehn are turkey hunting in southeastMissouri.

programme.title: Rocky Mountain Elk Foundation
programme.desc: Join Nashville songwriter Shane Minor as he heads to the Express UU Bar Ranch in New Mexico in search of a management bull. Learn about Shane's incredible past and present life as he reconnects with his roots in western hunting. Special thanks to Express UU Bar Ranch

programme.title: ConQuest 200
programme.desc: Join Doug Roberts as he selects his newest breeder bucks on the deer farm. Cutting antlers and visiting the annual youth buck pole marks the start of hunting season. Special guest Cody Robins from Live 2 Hunt.
