programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: There's no rest for the righteous and nobody knows this better then the Dog. He is committed to saving his new friend's bail bonding business, and now must race against time to bring a rogues gallery to justice.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Can Dog complete his mission to clean-up this frontier town? With four outlaws still on the lam, Dog sets out to bring 'em in. As day turns into night and with the darkness and the danger mounting, an undaunted Dog and team plan late night hits.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: With a long record of violence and abuse and weighing in at over 200lbs, Dog's target for the day does not sound like a gentle giant. When the trail grows cold Dog turns up the heat on the fugitive's brother and sister.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's case involves a Samoan so Dog knows that the runner's close-knit kinfolk hold the keys to bringing him in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog and his team are out to revoke bail on Eugene, a chronic heroin addict. They find him in a squalid apartment with a huge stockpile of syringes, and they can see that his physical condition is deteriorating.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is out to make two grabs on two islands in one day. Part of the team is dispatched to Kona to nab a woman who skipped her court date. Meanwhile, Dog and the others hunt Patrick, a fugitive who's fighting in an Extreme Boxing event on the Big Island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Baby Lyssa, who's just turned 18 and is studying to become a bondsman, gets to do some on-the-job training when she helps Dog hunt for Wayne, who's run out on a bond for second-degree assault.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Bounty hunts are always full of surprises and that is very true today. Dog is in search of a potentially dangerous fugitive, he's only 19 and charged with kidnapping and menacing.

programme.desc: When an offender with a long record ducks his day in court, Bobby Brown knows whom to call--The Dog! And knowing that few souls can resist Beth's clever persuasion, Dog gives her the job of luring the fugitive in.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Things are seldom what they seem in the world of bounty hunting and it is through this maze of illusions that Dog pursues his prey.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Other than bringing criminals to justice, one of Dog's loves is teaching the next generation of bounty hunters the tricks of the trade. Today he has a new student.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog believes in safety first, and today's hunt puts this philosophy to the test. The fugitive's problem with anger management increases the dangers of their already risky line of work. Dog warns the crew to be ready for anything as they head out.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: It's been quite a while since Tim Chapman put down his mace can and bulletproof vest to care for his growing family. When his old friend Dog calls asking for help tracking an elusive felon Tim jumps into action.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Dog is a big-hearted guy and today he's proving it. He's helping Mary Ellen, his friend and fellow bondsman, on a dangerous night hunt for a fugitive she is now regretting bailing out.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Only in Dog's world would a bantam fighting cock, a pregnant daughter, and a jungle safe house go together. And don't forget the mopeds as well a group of hostile squatters on government land! They're all part of the hunt for an elusive criminal.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: Today's fugitive is accused of assaulting a police officer, so Dog and the team are not taking any chances. While on the Big Island and Dog convinces the felon's friends and family to join forces and then learns he has fled to another island.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: The "Big Island" of Hawaii boasts both lush tropical splendor and stark volcanic beauty. But today Dog and the team can't spend much time taking in the sights, they need to help Leland hunt down some elusive fugitives.

programme.title: Dog the Bounty Hunter
programme.desc: This hunt is personal. Dog's good friend and fellow bondsman Chris is running out of time. He has only days to find his fugitive or risk losing his business. In his hunt Dog confronts duplicitous tipsters, vicious attack dogs, and hostile neighbors.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: The venue for tonight's program is Clubway 41, despite being voted Blackpool Tourist Board Restaurant of the year, the place is dire straits. It is the prime example of HOW NOT TO RUN A RESTAURANT. Owner DAVE is the flakey self-appointed head chef, who hasn't been in a kitchen for 30 years and can't cook. His partner DAWN invents bizarre dishes for the menu, ranging from "tomato and cointreau soup" to "pork with brie, nectarine and whiskey sauce". Gordon faces a hellish week, Clubway 41 is breaking every rule in book, can he bring Dave, Dawn and their food back to earth?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight's program sees Gordon Ramsay in Oscars in Nantwich. On the surface this place seems idyllic, an Irish family run restaurant in the heart of beautiful countryside. Owner MAURA runs the front of house and her son LENIN is the Head chef, but it's not "happy families". With her life savings on the line Maura is in big trouble. She constantly bickers with her son whilst the customers are forced to wait hours for their fluorescent crab stick paellas, and stodgy carbonaras from Oscars "bit of everything" menu.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's program Gordon Ramsay travels to the seaside to help ailing hotel and restaurant, The Sandgate. This is Lois and Peter's first venture into the catering industry - the happily married couple used to enjoy eating in restaurants, so thought it might be fun to own one. 18months later their dream has turned into a nightmare and they're loosing ~£4,000 a month.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: This week Gordon is at a god-awful Italian restaurant in Derby. La Gondola is stuck in a time-warp with naff Seventies cuisine, bad net curtains and no customers. New owner Daniela bought the place because she got married there back in the day but her sentimentality has blinded her to the fact that she's bagged a white elephant. Gordon's biggest problem is head chef Steve, one of the worst he's ever met, and one who'd rather open a tin of tuna or a packet of soup than create a proper meal. Can Gordon get the kitchen cooking again and save La Gondala from sinking?

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: Tonight, for the first time ever on Kitchen Nightmares, Gordon takes on a nightmare restaurant abroad. La Parra de Burriana is an ex-pat restaurant in Nerja on Spain's Costa del Sol. Nestling among the cafes lining the seafront offering all-day English breakfast and chips, La Parra is the brainchild of twenty-six-year-old ex-nightclub manager Laurence. He set himself up in business eighteen months ago with a loan from his dad and, although he's not an experienced chef, mans the kitchen on his own, determined to offer something better than chips to his largely British clientele.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Applegate, Oregon, to try to rescue the failing Applegate River Lodge. Despite being over a million dollars in debt, the owner, Richard Davis, is more interested in smoking cannabis than he is in fixing the problems of this family-built inn.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits Starkville, Mississippi to try to rescue the failing Hotel Chester. Despite having over 40 years experience in the hotel business, owner David Mollendor is at a loss on how to make his dream of owning his own hotel work.

programme.title: Hotel Hell
programme.desc: Gordon visits West Dover in Vermont, to try to save a dog-friendly hotel that’s desperately in need of help. Sandy MacDougall, the owner, runs the hotel like a hostel with unpaid staff staying in the rooms instead of paying guests.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's second programme Gordon tackles a pub for the first time, getting to grips with The Fenwick Arms in rural Lancashire. The pub is run by landlord Brian who, after thirty years in the business and a quadruple heart-bypass, still puts in 120 hours a week and insists on laying down the law in the kitchen. Despite their best endeavours Brian and his partner Elaine are ~£250k in debt, losing ~1500 a week and facing bankruptcy within three months unless there's a drastic reversal in their fortunes.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's programme Gordon finds a chef caught in a time warp when he tackles a picturesque but largely unfrequented upmarket restaurant in King's Lynn, a traditional market town on the Norfolk coast. For the last eighteen months ex Michelin-starred chef Nick has owned and run Rococo but his past success is now eluding him. The menu is past its sell-by date, the service is stuffy, the food is over-priced and the only thing being fed is his ego. Yet, despite debts of ~£100k and the prospect of putting his home at risk and his young family on the streets, Nick continues to cook comatose in a 1990s fantasy land of his own making.

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares
programme.desc: In tonight's final programme of the series Gordon grapples with girl power when he takes on an intimate family-run restaurant in the heart of WAG territory near Liverpool. For the last three years Morgan's has been run by antiques dealer-turned-restaurateur SANDY and her two daughters HELEN and LAURA. The beautifully-designed dining room has a prime high street location and should be the perfect eatery for the trendy local clientele. But Head Chef Phil is grappling with an eclectic menu that includes mashed potato with apricots and his cooking's just not up to it.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: In an unprecedented double autopsy, Dr. G is determined to find out who is accountable for these odd deaths and solve the mystery of a love triangle gone awry.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: It's up to Dr. G to determine if alcohol was to blame in a man's death or if there was a silent killer lurking in his body.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A neighbor hears odd sounds coming from the next apartment. When police arrive, they find a man bruised and dead. When all signs point to foul play, it's up to Dr. G to find proof of murder.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Police make a grisly discovery: a woman's battered and dead body. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must identify the body and determine the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A hotel clerk calls 9-1-1 complaining of severe facial trauma, but he has no recollection of what happened and dies soon after. Police are counting on Dr. G to aid them in this investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Authorities respond to a fire, only to find Carolyn Casey's body at the center of the blaze. With little evidence and no witnesses, Dr. G must find the cause of death to catch her killer.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A hotel clerk calls 9-1-1 complaining of severe facial trauma, but he has no recollection of what happened and dies soon after. Police are counting on Dr. G to aid them in this investigation.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: An otherwise healthy child had been complaining of stomach pains. Could the medicine his mother had recently given him be to blame? Or could his death be from something more sinister?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Even with many leads, including an insulin overdose, a tooth infection and chronic lupus, the pieces don't add up in the case of a woman's death. Will Dr. G be able to uncover the truth?

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Dr. G suspects that someone is responsible for a vagrant's unusual death. She'll only discover the truth by finding answers to the strange events surrounding this curious case.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: After driving to his parent's house, Cameron Walker finds his dad dead in bed, and his mom bound in the closet.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Parents rush their baby to the hospital, but she tragically dies in her mother's arms. Now, Dr. G must help these devastated parents understand what happened.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: All circumstances point to foul play in the case of a dead hunter and the police fear that a killer is on the loose. Dr. G must provide them with answers before there are more victims.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A train engineer panics when he spots a man lying on the tracks. He blows the whistle, but the train can't stop in time. It's up to Dr. G to piece together how Andy Santana died.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 45-year-old Natalie, who's visiting her sister from Australia, is found dead the morning after a heated argument with her estranged brother-in-law. Dr. G suspects foul play and she must race against the clock to give the police and Natalie's family the answers they need.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A mother of infant twins notices that her son is not breathing. EMTs attempt to revive him, but it's too late. Now, Dr. G must work fast to determine if the other twin's life is in danger.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: A daughter wants to surprise her dad with breakfast in bed but finds him unresponsive. His family is convinced they know what killed him, but Dr. G must let the evidence speak for itself.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: 58-year-old Leroy Williams is rushed to the ER by his wife after becoming disorientated. Doctors work tirelessly, but Leroy slips into a coma and eventually dies.

programme.title: Dr. G: Medical Examiner
programme.desc: Roy Cambells is found dead and covered with scratches, his aggressive 80lb dog by his side. Dr. G wonders if the dog could have been responsible for the man's death.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: Throughout history, many have believed that certain places, things, or even people can be tainted with dark curses. Ominous lakes that morph into watery graves.

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: What makes us want to create magnificent buildings that are bigger and grander than ourselves--and last for centuries?

programme.title: The UnXplained
programme.desc: The total disregard for life exhibited by serial killers shocks our sense of humanity and makes us question our safety and security.

programme.title: The UnXplained

programme.desc: Counting down the top artifacts that could provide evidence that extraterrestrials once walked among us.

programme.title: Ancient Aliens

programme.title: Ancient Aliens
programme.desc: Millions of people around the world have reported encountering shadowy entities who instill fear, shortness of breath, and even paralysis; they could be figments of the imagination or visitors from other worlds or dimensions.

programme.desc: According to Ancient Astronaut Theorists, the placement of monoliths and their geological makeup could point to extraterrestrial intervention.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: A powerful union activist disappears from a Detroit suburb; 45 years later, it remains one of the most notorious missing person cases of all time; the mystery of Jimmy Hoffa's disappearance features more twists and turns than a Hollywood movie.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: It's one of the most famous prehistoric monuments on Earth -- a mysterious arrangement of stones that have adorned the English countryside for millennia; nobody knows how the landmark was built or why.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: Following news of the history-making discovery of Sir Ernest Shackleton's ship the Endurance, this is a look at his historic and ill-fated 1914 Antarctic expedition resulting in the loss of the highly revered ship.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: On Christmas morning in 1945, five siblings vanish from their family home in West Virginia during a raging fire; despite the work of dozens of investigators and thousands of amateur sleuths, the mystery remains.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: They've been called the world's greatest archaeological enigma: 2,000-year-old geoglyphs made in the Peruvian desert that span over 50 miles; the drawings are so massive, they can only be seen from the air.

programme.title: History's Greatest Mysteries
programme.desc: In July 1996, one of the worst aviation disasters in American history leaves 230 people dead and countless questions unanswered; it's a tragedy that changes the aviation industry forever.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: The Aryan Brotherhood of Texas is a white supremacist gang that boasted thousands of members inside and outside of prison throughout Texas and the United States; most of the gang's violence outside of prison is inflicted upon its own members.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: With a taste of success and the lure of easy money, Thelma started transporting cocaine and heroin between Los Angeles and Philadelphia.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Bostic's New Breeds would package and distribute heroin and defend their turf with violence.

programme.title: Gangsters: America's Most Evil
programme.desc: Salvatore "Sammy the Bull" Gravano, the most notorious turncoat in mafia history, pledges loyalty to John Gotti until Gotti himself gets the Bull to change his mind.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: Before he hunted down his first victim in the wilds of Alaska, Robert Hansen was a successful businessman with a family in Anchorage, but his intense feelings would build into a dark desire to exert the ultimate control over 17 victims.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: Growing up gay and effeminate in the hyper masculine bayou was tough on Ronald Dominique; an inability to connect and a sexual assault in jail may have cemented his decision to kill his first victim, tragically the beginning of years of murder.

programme.title: First Blood
programme.desc: The articulate and boastful killer is remembered for terrifying the coastal town of Santa Cruz, where he picked up and dismembered hitchhiking college students in the early 1970s.

programme.title: Surviving a Serial Killer
programme.desc: David McVicker was unaware he'd climbed into the van of murderer William Bonin when he hitchhiked home at 14 years old; David survived but was left scarred.

programme.title: Surviving a Serial Killer
programme.desc: Unaware that he was a killer, Delia Balmer begins a relationship with John Sweeney after meeting him in a pub in Camden; more than three years later, he has Delia lined up as his next victim.

programme.desc: A trusted nanny to three young children snaps after being plagued by demonic voices, leading to devastating consequences for the family she worked for.

programme.desc: Erika and her boyfriend Omar plotted to kill Erika's parents and set up home as parents to her little brother.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a young boy and his mother were kidnapped and murdered by a vicious drug cartel, FBI agents in the field worked tirelessly to pierce the secretive drug underworld and unearth those involved. Their surveillance and investigative work uncovered a violent trail of murder and greed. FBI agents and forensic examiners pieced together the evidence needed to draw out and then crush the cartel.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Residents of the small town of Noel, Missouri were shocked when one of their banks was robbed. When the bank president was nowhere to be found, the residents were outraged. The FBI discovered that things are not always as they appear. Minute clues led the agents to the body of the bank president. With no suspects, the FBI relied on dogged determination and modern forensics. Agents slowly pieced together tiny shreds of evidence.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On the day before Thanksgiving, a mother discovered her 10 year-old son was missing from his school. No one knew how it could have happened. Within hours, the boy's entire family was frantically searching for him. The few leads in the case quickly turned cold and the FBI was called in to aid in the investigation. The search by agents and local authorities would cover a thousand miles to expose the kidnapper and find the missing child.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: The rapes and murders of ten women near Tampa, Florida in 1984 had the authorities puzzled and the community scared. Since the beginning, the FBI had been analyzing the crime scene evidence and had found a common link: red trilobal carpet fibers. But there was no suspect, until one of the killer's potential victims survived. Through her interviews and the cooperation of local authorities and the FBI, 31-year-old Bobby Joe Long emerged as the prime suspect.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In February of 1996, New Jersey millionaire Frank Black flew to Florida to close a major business deal before retiring. He never came home. Authorities in New Jersey sensed foul play and brought in the FBI. Agents learned of a mystery woman in Florida who was to meet Black. Phone records showed a flood of calls to Black from his business rival just before the disappearance.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A Labor Day weekend turned into a nightmare of murder as a cross-country crime spree terrorized the nation. In a small Ohio community, an elderly woman and a teenage boy disappeared within hours of each other. Police believed the cases were linked, but didn't know how. They contacted the FBI for help. A trail of stolen vehicles and murder victims across seven states led agents on a hunt for two suspected killers. Their only hope of stopping them was to anticipate the killers' next move.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Residents of the small town of Noel, Missouri were shocked when one of their banks was robbed. When the bank president was nowhere to be found, the residents were outraged. The FBI discovered that things are not always as they appear. Minute clues led the agents to the body of the bank president. With no suspects, the FBI relied on dogged determination and modern forensics. Agents slowly pieced together tiny shreds of evidence.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When five-year-old Melissa Brannen disappeared from a Christmas party in December 1989, the only probable suspect was 24-year-old Caleb Hughes. Hughes reportedly left the party around the time Melissa vanished, but no one saw him with the girl. Fifty blue acrylic fibers collected during a search of Hughes' car, however, became the major piece of evidence in the case. FBI fiber analysis determined that those fibers were identical to the ones that made up the sweater Melissa was wearing.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a successful television producer was gunned down in his New York office. It looked like a professional hit. With no leads, the investigation stalled. Four years later and a continent away, a man told Los Angeles police he had been hired to murder two exotic dancers. Investigators linked the two crimes and uncovered a businessman willing to kill to protect his interests.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Arizona, a shipment of money vanished into the high desert, along with the two men hired to guard it. The FBI didn't know if the guards were participants or victims of an ambush. Answers lay somewhere in the thousands of square miles of Arizona's northwest territory. When the vehicle was recovered with three hundred thousand dollars and the drivers missing, suspicions that the crime was an inside job grew.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: A 1981 armored car robbery near New York City left one guard dead and another critically wounded. Police stopped suspects nearby and another shoot-out ensued, claiming the lives of two officers. Local police and the FBI suspected a large group of domestic terrorists with a history of violent crime. They would try to ferret out these heavily armed criminals who moved in a shadowy underworld and were not afraid to kill authorities.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Memphis, Tennessee, a horrible crime terrified local residents. When a wealthy young mother was abducted in front of her in-laws' home, the police had no shortage of suspects. The twenty-five year old victim left behind a tumultuous marriage, an ex-husband, and several spurned boyfriends. All were on the FBI's short list. To find the woman and her abductor, investigators would have to first determine the motive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1980, the FBI began a massive undercover operation, code named Safebet, that was designed to expose the Chicago Mafia's infiltration into the city's surrounding suburbs. Undercover agents quickly discovered that the mob had its tentacles spread into every facet of the law enforcement community. They unwittingly uncovered the murder of a wealthy socialite perpetrated by a jealous and greedy mob lawyer and covered up by the local police chief.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Corruption in the New Orleans Police Department grew like a cancer in the early 1990's. Lured by the easy wealth of the narcotics industry, crooked cops began breaking the laws they were sworn to uphold. They would stop at nothing, including murder, to protect their rackets. When it became clear they could no longer police themselves, the FBI got involved. Putting their lives on the line, undercover agents devised a way to flush out the violent cops and restore trust in the city's police force.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the summer of 1988, a wealthy Jackson, Mississippi woman disappeared from her home in broad daylight. Left behind was a mysterious ransom note listing twelve names and no specific instructions. The note, and a few drops of blood were the only clues to her fate. FBI and local police struggled to find answers in the cryptic message so they could find the kidnapper and retrieve the victim before her time ran out. Solving the crime required the keen insight of a criminal profiler and the perseverance of a family, local authorities, and the FBI.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1986, a small crime free Indiana town was turned inside out by the arrival of one dangerous stranger. After an officer was gunned down at point-blank range, the psychotic killer led investigators across the Midwest. No one knew where the gunman would strike next, even as his tally of murders and abductions grew. The FBI and state police raced against time to rescue America's heartland from this deranged gunman, before he killed again.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1997, FBI agents began investigating New York gas station mogul Gurmeet Dhinsa for gas pump rigging. They soon realized that Dhinsa was more than a crooked businessman, he enforced his mob-like operation with brutal violence, kidnapping and killing errant employees and any family members who questioned their deaths. FBI agents worked their way into Dhinsa's violent world.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On Mississippi's Gulf Coast, a judge and his politician wife were brutally murdered in their home. The killer left few clues and the investigation led nowhere. But the FBI was patiently waiting in the wings. Once it was determined that federal laws had been violated, they pounced on the investigation. They uncovered a corrupt local government and a group of violent criminal conspirators known as the Dixie Mafia, responsible for fraud, money laundering and murder.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: At first it seemed like a tragic hunting accident when 18-year-old David Wilkey was shot to death in rural Virginia in 1983. A tenacious insurance investigator suspected foul play, but he had no direct evidence. Two years later a man contacted North Carolina FBI agents with a complex story of conspiracy and murder-for-hire: he claimed he had been hired to murder Wilkey's killer.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Langley, Virginia, a gunman fired into rush hour traffic. The brazen daytime shooting of employees from the Central Intelligence Agency stunned the country. The victims seemed randomly selected, but the motive appeared to be political. The FBI was called in, but the nationwide search quickly became a far-reaching international manhunt. Agents processed more than 2000 leads and crossed an ocean in the effort to deliver justice.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: Local law enforcement became stumped when the body of an unidentified young woman turned up on a highway in their small Pennsylvania town. They turned to the FBI labs. The hi-tech lab enabled investigators and agents to identify the victim. Knowing who she was allowed agents to reconstruct her every move. Though the road to finding her killer was twisted and long, agents persisted.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In Alabama, a pair of convicted felons escaped the custody of a local deputy and fled across the country. Eluding authorities, they moved from state to state in a wave of abduction and car theft. When a foreign military officer disappeared along their trail, police and FBI agents wondered if the armed fugitives had become killers. Agents believed the pair were growing more violent and raced to find the escapees before more victims crossed their path.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On February 3, 1990, a 14-year-old girl ran away from her mother's home and disappeared without a trace. Her mother hoped Pasadena, Texas police could find her before it was too late. Six months later, their worst fear was realized when a farmer discovered the young girl's remains in an Illinois barn. The FBI was called in to help. Agents tracked down a trucker who they believed was responsible for 50 more deaths. Investigators knew they had to stop this menace of the highways.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1990's drug gangs terrorized Harlem, New York neighborhoods. When a 10-year-old boy fell victim in the crossfire, NYPD detectives and FBI agents clamped down on the problem. They formed a task force called C-11, designed to dismantle the gangs. In an environment of violence and fear it would be difficult to identify, arrest and convict those involved in the secretive and deadly world of big money drugs.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: By December 1985, John Gotti had assumed his place as the new Don of the Gambino crime family in New York with the assassination of his boss, Paul Castellano. The Teflon Don felt secure in his position, always remaining one step ahead of the law. But he was also the ongoing obsession of Bruce Mouw, leader of an elite crew of FBI agents formed to bring down the Gambino family. With the help and genius of his Special Projects Squad, bugs were planted in Gotti's most private meeting places.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In the early 1980s, the decapitation of a young African-American male led the Miami-Dade police department and the FBI along a trail of murder. Investigators quickly discovered that the victim was a dissident member of a religious sect headed by a man calling himself Yahweh ben Yahweh, or God, Son of God. Although the FBI believed Yahweh ben Yahweh and his followers were responsible for many murders, they could find no direct evidence linking them to the crimes.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When police in a small Washington State community began looking into the disappearance of a 22-year-old woman, they had no way of knowing it would evolve into a nationwide hunt for a sexual sadist. Police knew the killer's identity, but he was a master of disguise. The FBI was called on to help. Agents discovered that several unsuspecting women across the northwest had fallen prey to his charms.

programme.title: Los Archivos del FBI (Doblado)
programme.desc: El 21 de junio de 1964, tres defensores de los derechos civiles, uno blanco y uno negro, desaparecieron de Mississippi mientras cruzaban el condado de Neshoba. Una investigación del FBI a gran escala llevó a la recuperación de los cuerpos de los hombres asesinados y la evidencia física fue recuperada y analizada. Los laboratorios del FBI confirmaron que todas excepto una de las balas usadas para asesinar a los hombres provenían de la misma arma. El FBI se ganó la confianza de un informante, cuya información condujo a la condena de siete miembros del Ku Klux Klan local.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: When a Delaware woman vanished in 1996, family and friends discovered her secret life. The appointments secretary to the Governor had carried on an illicit affair with a wealthy married man. Agents suspected that her powerful ex-lover was responsible, but they had little physical evidence to support their theory. Investigators never found the woman's body or the murder weapon. The FBI's only hope was to go undercover, and turn brother against brother.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1987, a successful television producer was gunned down in his New York office. It looked like a professional hit. With no leads, the investigation stalled. programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On August 20, 1980, an unseen sniper murdered two young black men as they jogged with two white women in Salt Lake City, Utah. Police threw all their resources into finding a killer who left almost no clues behind. They met with FBI agents and detectives from around the country who had similar racially motivated sniper slayings. A month later, working off little more than a possible license plate number, police in Kentucky arrested Joseph Paul Franklin but the man escaped from custody.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: On a summer night in 1990, a body was discovered burning in a Minnesota alley. Weeks later, police finally identified the victim, a suspected drug courier from California. The FBI began working with local police and slowly uncovered a multi-state crime ring run by a deadly drug lord who used violence and intimidation to keep those around him silent. Agents needed to infiltrate and dismantle the crew before more people died.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: California Highway Patrolman George Gwaltney discovered the body of 23-year-old Robin Bishop near her car on a remote desert highway. Although he proclaimed his innocence the FBI lab experts were able to link tool marks found on the frame with tools found in Gwaltney's home. Through the match of hairs and fibers and a unique test for detecting and identifying sperm, Gwaltney was placed at the scene of the crime.

As the robbers became increasingly violent, pressure mounted to end their reign. With few leads, the FBI forced their own luck. The effort put them face to face with an armed and desperate fugitive.

programme.title: The FBI Files
programme.desc: In 1992, a young mother was gunned down in front of her children. Police searched for answers, but found none. The horrible crime appeared unmotivated, senseless, and random. programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In the series premiere, NYPD Detective Raimy Sullivan (PEYTON LIST) discovers she's able to speak with her deceased father, Frank (RILEY SMITH) over his old ham radio.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: When Raimy warns Frank that her mom will be murdered unless he can somehow warn her, she also delivers some devastating news about Stan Moreno (ANTHONY RUIVIVAR).

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: After Raimy uncovers evidence in the Goff case, she relays this information to Frank, prompting him to take matters into his own hands while ignoring a strong warning from Satch.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: With the date of Julie's abduction rapidly approaching, Raimy and Frank each work to gather information from a girl whose mother was taken by the Nightingale.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: When Frank helps Raimy uncover clues from the past to help solve a present day murder case, it brings up two different memories of her first day in the NYPD.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In 2016, Raimy meets a strange character named Karl (CURTIS ARMSTRONG), who speaks to himself in the future. In 1996, Frank feels like he's being taunted by The Nightingale.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: Raimy and Satch's detective work begins to pay off when a cold case victim leads them to their biggest break -- a room where the Nightingale held his first victim.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: While Raimy and Satch discover a shocking connection to the Nightingale's first kill, Frank and Julie are forced to have an honest conversation. And Raimy has a surprise visitor.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In the winter finale, Raimy and Frank make a startling discovery about the Nightingale Killer. Meanwhile, Frank is blindsided by a shocking betrayal.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: Frank & Raimy plan to kill the Nightingale, but Frank finds himself agonizing over whether it's the right thing to do. And Raimy is confronted with an unexpected moral decision.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: Raimy and Frank find themselves in the thick of things. Meanwhile, Frank learns the meaning behind a betrayal.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: Raimy and Frank make a huge discovery while continuing their search for the Nightingale killer. Meanwhile, Stan is willing to do anything to bring Frank down.

programme.title: Frequency
programme.desc: In the season finale, the truth is revealed and Raimy makes a discovery that stops her cold. She quickly reaches out to Frank on the ham radio to voice her concerns.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Smart and quirky Megan Smith (JoANNA GARCIA) is offered a job as the live-in tutor of beautiful and rebellious twin teen millionaires in Palm Beach, Florida.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: When Laurel points Megan's sister, Lily, as being inappropriately dressed at a glamorous social event, Megan lies to Laurel about knowing her. Megan and Sage argue over Rose.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan meets with Rose's headmaster, Jacob Cassidy (recurring guest star DAVID GIUNTOLI), and is disarmed by his age and good looks. Plus, the twins skip tutoring for a yacht party.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan gets too much information about the twins' sex lives, and her own insecurities show up during a date with Jacob (recurring guest star DAVID GIUNTOLI).

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan is forced to cancel her plans for a spa weekend with Jacob (recurring guest star DAVID GIUNTOLI) when Laurel demands she act as chaperone for Rose and Sage's pool party.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: A photo shoot with Rose and Sage for Laurel's upcoming marketing campaign with top photographer Rocco Zaretti (guest star NIGEL BARKER - "America's Next Top Model") is a disaster.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan reconnects with her estranged father (guest star JOHN ALLEN NELSON - "24") and asks Marco to prepare dinner for two at the estate. Lily, Will, Rose and Sage also show up.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan learns a secret about Laurel's past. Sage meets with publicist Patricia Kingston (guest star KATHY NAJIMY - "Numb3rs"), but she is only interested if Rose is also involved.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: The twins encounter blogger PEREZ HILTON on the red carpet at a club and SARAH DREW ("Everwood") guest stars as Megan's best friend from Yale, Caryn.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan has a great date with Will but can't deal with the fact that he is also dating other women. When Rose gets a bad grade on an exam, she decides to cheat on her next test.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Will and Megan's new romance is threatened when Will plans to accept a job in Brazil. Sage "tortures" Charlie's cousin, Luis (IGNACIO SERRICCHIO), who gets a job in the kitchen.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan's mother, Shelby (guest star SHARON LAWRENCE - "NYPD Blue"), who abandoned the family when Megan was a child, returns. Will is jealous when Megan turns to Charlie for advice.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan confronts her mother, Shelby (SHARON LAWRENCE), Rose and Sage throw an elaborate charity dinner and Marco's boyfriend, Keith (DAVID MONAHAN), pushes Marco to quit his job.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Megan wants Lily out of jail, but her father (JOHN ALLEN NELSON) thinks Lily should be left there to learn a lesson. Shelby (SHARON LAWRENCE) later asks Will for the bail money.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Rose's boyfriend, Zach (DAVID FRANCO), gets upset after seeing a picture of Rose and Sage with bassist PETE WENTZ of the band Fallout Boy. Megan meets Will's parents.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: Charlie surprises Megan by admitting he has been in love with her for years. Will reacts badly to the news. And Rose gets some surprising news of her own.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: The twins confront Laurel with their shocking news. Rose knows Sage is keeping something from her and when Sage finally confesses her secret, it changes their relationship.

programme.title: Privileged
programme.desc: KATHY GRIFFIN appears as Keith (DAVID MONOHAN) and Marco's wedding planner. Megan and Will fight and break up, leaving Megan solo at the wedding. But does she leave solo?

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Police officers Van Ray and Deaqon "Deaq" Hayes go undercover to pursue the worst criminals in L.A. They get help from Billie Chambers, their contact within the police department.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq encounter a trio of female jewel thieves who destroy a sports car from the Candy Store. The cops pose as wealthy jewel buyers, but the operation soon goes awry.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq are sent to infiltrate a gang of Russian mobsters. The partners must also stop the contents of a dangerous shipment from entering the United States.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: When Deaq's ex has trouble leaving her abusive husband, Alton, Van worries about Deaq's emotional investment in the case. He and Billie must save Deaq when he's exposed as a cop.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq open a hip Hollywood nightclub to trap a major ring dealing Ecstasy. When the investigation encounters problems, Billie gets involved.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van frees his legendary convict father, Raymond, from prison to help with a counterfeiting case.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: After Deaq poses as a corrupt cop who threatens to expose assassin Sophia Jones, Billie and Van follow her. They must race to prevent Deaq from becoming Sophia's next victim.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie assigns Van and Deaq to infiltrate a drug ring along with Alexa, her best friend from the police academy. The situation quickly worsens, and Alexa's life is put in danger.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq struggle to reconcile their different investigative styles when they go undercover to apprehend a murderous pimp. Soon they must make a life-or-death decision.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie arranges for Van and Deaq to work with Shane, a gang member they've apprehended, to infiltrate a Mexican gang. But Shane proves unreliable and consequences could be deadly.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq pursue a pair of robbers who use an all-girl valet service to gain access. After the guys learn their targets are lesbians, Billie goes undercover to solve this one.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie orders Van and Deaq to train a rookie cop, Jarod. The guys pursue two dangerous blackmailers, but Van is taken hostage. Jarod must take action on his own to save Van.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq infiltrate a criminal enterprise led by a thug who hires out-of-town assassins to kill cops. Meanwhile, Billie fends off the chief investigator from Internal Affairs.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Under increased pressure from the chief investigator of Internal Affairs, Rolland Hill, Billie decides to help Van and Deaq put an end to a recent spate of cop killings.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van, Billie, Deaq and a sexy young counterfeiter, Gretchen, devise a scheme to save Van's father, Raymond, and capture a crime boss.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq's assignment gets complicated when a witness turns out to be a former acquaintance, Cassidy Shaw. And assassin Sophia Jones soon joins forces with Cassidy.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie assigns Van and Deaq to protect the 19-year-old daughter of a former arms dealer. But she hates her father, doesn't comprehend the danger and does not want to be protected.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Van and Deaq try to capture a violent psychopath whose killing spree doesn't seem to make sense. They cope with the frustration of a case that may be too bizarre even for them.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: As the birthday of Deaq's murdered brother approaches, Van and Billie realize that he's coping with painful memories.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: Billie and Van go undercover to end the partnership between a crystal methamphetamine manufacturer, Murdoch Goucher, and a pornography producer, Lena, who distributes the drug.

programme.title: Fastlane
programme.desc: After a long undercover operation, Van hopes for some relaxation. But his situation soon becomes life-threatening. Meanwhile, an uncovered secret could bring serious repercussions.

programme.title: The Growing Toll of America's Booming Kratom Industry
programme.desc: American use of the Southeast Asian plant kratom has grown dramatically in recent years, spurring both a lucrative industry and national lobbying effort while worrying health experts who fear its addictive effects and point to thousands of related deaths. In this Bloomberg Originals documentary, we reveal how the unregulated substance is being promoted and even made more potent, and how some users are ending up dead.

programme.title: Hit Me With Your Best Spot
programme.desc: From burlesque to roller skating to a Titanic museum, our local Orlando experts won’t lead you astray. We’ve got rock stars and drag queens who are passionate about ‘The City Beautiful’ and know exactly which spots are worth your time.

programme.title: KCRA Local News
programme.desc: Get the latest news and weather from KCRA.

programme.title: KCRA Game On: Fight for the Kings
programme.desc: Game On: Fight for the Kings is a KCRA 3 documentary with never-before-heard stories of the four-month fight, the friendships garnered between the rival cities, and Sacramento doing the unimaginable: winning the battle for the Kings.

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: Andrew returned home from serving his country with a toothache so bad he covers his mouth out of habit. Mickey had forgotten how to smile after years of struggle with addiction and abuse. Will the FIXT team help them smile again?

programme.title: FIXT
programme.desc: A horrific accident doomed Allison to a lifetime of pain and failed surgeries. In search of a brighter smile, Mar-cia’s seen half a dozen dentists, but remains unsatisfied. Can FIXT tech meet the needs of their deserving clients?

programme.title: Queens of Birmingham
programme.desc: Queens of Birmingham invites you to slip into your high heels and sashay over the rainbow. Join the DREAMCAST of Al's on 7th, the region's preeminent drag bar, and meet the fiercest divas in the South.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A man vanishes from a boarding house in 1988. The fight to find him uncovers one of the most shocking cases in Sacramento history and the surprising revelation of a grandmotherly-looking serial killer hiding in plain sight.

programme.title: The Middle Child
programme.desc: In the 1980s, a serial killer buried a woman and three girls in the woods of New Hampshire. One of those girls is still unidentified. WMUR joins the investigators who promise they won’t give up until her name is restored.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Six people are slain in a home in a quiet Iowa town. One person survives a gunshot to the head and claims to have no memory of the incident. The tragedy and eventual trial shred the social fabric of the neighborhood.

programme.title: Sports Town Stories
programme.desc: Each episode of this documentary series features incredible sports stories from iconic American cities. From gritty underdog victories to passionate unlikely match-ups, the series proves that sports are so much more than a pastime.

programme.title: What's On The Menu?
programme.desc: What's On The Menu?

programme.title: In Transit by Esquire
programme.desc: Host Dave Holmes meets celebrity guests at the airport bar to discuss must-do activities in cities across America. So when you’re ready to board your next flight, you’ll have an Esquire-approved itinerary.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Watch things heat up in the kitchen as two local chefs go head-to-head to create a three-course meal utilizing ingredients sourced from one of the city’s unique marketplaces.

programme.title: Absolutely Albuquerque
programme.desc: Amanda Machon meets with a different guest each episode who will show off their favorite spots in Albuquerque and the best way to experience this one-of-a-kind city. This series is all about discovering everything that makes ABQ unique and exciting.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Chaos & Kindness
programme.desc: Join New Hampshire-based band Recycled Percussion as they perform acts of kindness in their community, and across the country. In each episode, you'll witness the great lengths and hilarious things they're willing to do in the name of kindness.

programme.title: Maddy & Dixie Take Sactown
programme.desc: Maddy & Dixie are social media influencers who have nothing but love for Sacramento. Join them as they explore the heart and soul of the city through incredible activities, hidden gems, amazing eats and the locals who make Sactown so special.

programme.title: Underdog Uprising
programme.desc: Every game day, fans pour into the stands to cheer on New Mexico's soccer team. But these are no ordinary supporters. From the Curse, to Sektor 114, to the Black Diamonds these fans are making New Mexico United.

programme.title: Crimes, Cons & Capers
programme.desc: These days, cameras are everywhere. Those up to no good can run, but Big Brother is always watching.

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: Easy Money: Fraud, Fortune and Failures
programme.desc: (2021) With nearly 15 hours of interviews from 17 people – and dozens of hours of news footage — Easy Money tells the story of what is being called the worst fraud in California history.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: The disappearance of 16-year-old JaRay Wilson spawns rumors of human trafficking in her small town in 2012. Investigators find her body and the truth, after an unlikely informant provides new details.

programme.title: Ballin' in Baltimore
programme.desc: Angel gears up for a day of nonstop action with adrenaline-junkie and restaurateur, Steve Chu. They get their hearts pumping with crazy-fast jet skis, hardcore jiu jitsu training, a sky-high ropes course and an epic paintball showdown.

programme.title: My Amazing Cheap Date
programme.desc: Local New Orleans eats, levee tours and Cajun and African drum dancing on two cheap dates in New Orleans.

programme.title: Free Spirit

programme.title: West By Orphan Train
programme.desc: A gripping documentary uncovering real stories of children loaded on trains, sent west, and presented “for the picking.” From 1854 to 1929, over 6,000 children landed in Iowa communities. Discover their emotional journeys and impact on the Midwest.

programme.title: Plate It!
programme.desc: Seafood starter, seafood main, seafood…dessert? Chef Janine Villalobos and Chef Aziz Bellarbi-Sala push the limits of fish-forward dining to try to ""catch"" the judges’ favor.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: In 1990, an 18-year-old driving across Wisconsin to a job conference never arrives. After her van and later her body are discovered, the mystery surrounding Berit Beck’s death persists for more than two decades. What happened in that van?

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: Single father Kendal Fenwick is the 295th homicide in Baltimore in 2015. Family and investigators wonder whether his efforts to curb drugs and violence in his neighborhood made him a target. Or is it something else entirely?

programme.title: Finding Adventure
programme.desc: Camryn Simpson, a 21-year-old student at the University of Pittsburgh and ambassador on social media platforms can’t take time away from her phone. With the help of Kinga, Camryn will log-out of social media and log-in to the outdoors to find adventure.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: One evening in 1999, Cythnia Jaramillo shows up at a home wearing nothing but a dog collar. She had been tortured and sexually assaulted for days. Her escape leads investigators to discover a gruesome string of kidnappings and murders.

programme.title: Hometown Tragedy
programme.desc: A true crime series telling the story of unfathomable crimes that have rocked American communities leaving them forever changed.

programme.title: Ed & Day in The 'Burgh

programme.title: Local Love
programme.desc: One local single experiences some of the best their city has to offer on three blind dates. Our singles may spend three perfect days out on the town, but there can only be one love match. Who will be picked for a second date?

programme.title: Blind Kitchen
programme.desc: Chefs recreate each other’s signature dish, but they can only determine what the dish is using their senses of taste, touch and smell. When the masks come off, the heat is on, with each chef attempting to cook their opponent’s creation.

programme.title: The Spark
programme.desc: From professional hockey players to award-winning muralists, The Spark highlights the craft, the journey, and the joy. These masters and thought leaders may have made names for themselves on the national stage, but they never forget the city that sparks their inspiration daily

programme.title: Stitch

programme.title: Finding Adventure
